channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2023120137
item.description:
Report E-2023120137

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XQC experienced a UN1760 Gunsmoke release from a box containing (2) 2.5-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2.5-gallons of material released from one of the jugs due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents and pH Up neutralizer were utilized to clean and neutralize the release. The empty damaged drum, impacted absorbents, PPE, and impacted cardboard were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023120429
item.description:
Report X-2023120429

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package containing 4 glass bottles(4L) of methanol. The box was left outside the hazmat cage, when picked up box was wet from one bottle that had the top broken off and caused spill inside. The other bottles inside are undamaged. Possible improper handling could be cause of damage. DescribePack: Box was stained from spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside a hazmat bag, slanted inside a plastic bin.

item.title: Report E-2023120180
item.description:
Report E-2023120180

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one poly 330 gallon tote of prekote 30-266 (UN1268) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one gallon of product had been released. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023120129
item.description:
Report E-2023120129

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: MELROSE PARK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 30, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was crushed in transit and released approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel removed one (1) damaged and leaking 5-gallon pail from the load, and they wiped down any impacted pails with absorbent pads. The remediated pails were restacked and rewrapped for further shipment and processing. All spent absorbent pads and the one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was labeled as hazardous and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2023120118
item.description:
Report E-2023120118

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 1oz spill of "Lacquer Thinner" from a 5gal metal pail was crushed by freight on the trailer loaded at the XCW terminal that impacted the trailer floor. The product is shipped as a "UN1263, Paint Related Material, HazClass 3, PGII". After reviewing the SDS with the terminal, it was determined that the staff could safely clean the spill using absorbents, proper skin/eye PPE, keeping the material away from ignition sources, and avoiding eating/drinking/smoking near the spill. The total waste content, being the wasted products, spent absorbents, and damaged container were packed into a 10gal metal waste container and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023120245
item.description:
Report X-2023120245

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: COLLINSVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 11/10/2023, 13:58:31 Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5010097 at the station in Collinsville, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consists of two metal cans packed in a fiberboard box. Both cans appeared to have leaked at the seams, resulting in spillage. The spill was contained in the ULD asset. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET AND WITH SMELL OF ACID. UPON INSPECTION, ALL BOTTLES HAD LEAKED FROM LOOSE/VENTED CAPS. PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED. DescribePack: ALL BOTTLES LEAKED FROM LOOSE/VENTED CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED.

item.title: Report X-2023120140
item.description:
Report X-2023120140

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found near door 150 on the other side of the load 1 belt. Package was outside of its box sitting inside a plastic bag. The box was upside down. Upon investigation it was determined that the plastic bag had a tear in it and had leaked out some of the contents. Item was a white powder and the box had Fully Regulated HazMat labeling. Package was immediately taken off the warehouse floor and isolated from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: The plastic bag did not have a seal on it of any kind. This kept the plastic bag inside open, which caused a leak. There was also a small hole on the bottom of the bag. This caused leakage from two separate areas. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.

item.title: Report E-2023120058
item.description:
Report E-2023120058

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDP experienced a UN1263 RC Lacquer Solvent release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 35-gallons of product released to a 35’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor and a 35’ x 15’ area of the asphalt lot below due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. The impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023120056
item.description:
Report E-2023120056

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1736 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XLA. It was reported that approximately 6 gallons of CCT 800 (AFCO 6055) Nitric Acid Gel Clear was released from two 5-gallon plastic jerrycans due to improper loading. The load shifted and crushed the cans. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 10' x 15' area of the trailer floor due to the pails falling over in transit. The damaged pails, impacted absorbents, impacted pallets, and cleanup debris were containerized into (5) 55-gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler noticed the box was wet when unloading trailer. Box was placed in a lined tote and sent to QA for inspection. Upon inspection by QA, package was placed in a yellow salvage drum to be processed ASAP. DescribePack: One bottle has a broken seal causing liquid to leak from the cap. Nearly half of the liquid from bottle has leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Was placed upright in a lined tote and sent to QA for inspection when found in trailer. Upon inspection, package was then placed in a yellow salvage drum to be processed.

item.title: Report I-2023090115
item.description:
Report I-2023090115

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T00:34:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-19
  • City: WILLOW SPRINGS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the evening of 05/19/2023 a drum of ChemCare waste pickup that afternoon from Henkel in Elgin, IL was found to be leaking on the pickup trailer upon check in. One drum of waste profile 75-13800 was overpack once leak was discovered. Approximately two gallons of material appeared to have been released. Spill contained to within trailer and direct below trailer on concrete pad at the loading dock. Spill was cleanup properly by operators upon discovery. No exposure to employees, no impact to sewer or waterways.
